addressleaf.section:
To the honorable S
r
Robert Sidney knight L. Governor of
e towne of Flushing

page.lettertext:
fol.156r
S
r
Tho Bodley to S
r
Robert Sydney
This bearer came to signifie of his going to
Flushing, when yo
r
L
dship
letter came unto
me of
e last of Marche. And for the
enterprise whereof yow write, if it can be
achieved w
t
out
e states, then better so, then
not at all. But happely tract of time will
minister some ouverture, to effect it well
enough W
t
out their privitie.
Count Maurice
hath promised this
Councell,
at his arrival
in
Zeland,
to cause two companies of their
owne to be sent to
Ostend.
If it come yo
r
L. well to passe, as I think it will,
to speake w
t
him of it, a worde or two
unto him, to hasten his promise, will
be very requisit. For as farre as I can
perceave by
e
Governor
of
Berghen;
he
was not willed by her
Ma
ties
letter, to
send any thither, unles
e
states
did
neglect it. I knowe
S
r
Edward Norreis
will be very muche trobled to be thus
disappointed: but the Councell here is
trobled more, that they can not co
m
and
in a towne of their owne. For mine
owne part I thinke I knowe their humor
so well, as I suppose they will rather
doe; as at
Gertrudenbergh,
give
e towne
to
e Enemie, then be bridles of their
willes. It doth revive am
o
g some a
sinister suspici
o
,
at her Ma
ties
ministers
would be masters of their townes, and
bring their Contrey into thraldome as
muche as
e Spaniards: whose governme
t
they abjured for defense of their liberties.
In effect
e end of this course will but falle
to be troublesome and prejudiciall, both to her Ma
tie
herself, and to all o
r
nati
o
and her Ma
ties
service advanced nothing by it.
S
r
Francis Vere
hath
written from
Utrecht
unto me, that it hath bin his owne good happe, to finde
e
theefe
at robbed him. this mony is all come to 15
li
but it seemeth his apparell
will be all recovered.
Having no other mater I end w
t
all good wishes to
yo
r
L. endevors. Fr
o
e Hage. Ap 4 1591 Yo
r
L. at commaundem
t
Tho. Bodley
